channel.title: How to turn % into degrees for a circle graph {GUIDE}
channel.description:
Ok I learned this in math since math is the worst subject known to man...
Take the % and turn it into a degrees (12% 12`) (`means degrees not really but bare with me here) take 12 put in into a fraction (12/100) add all the percentages together and multiply by (n) and divide by 100 (12x100divided by 100=12) add a fraction to 12/100 and ?/360 (since 360 is the degrees for a fulll circle) draw arrows diagonly and multiply each one (12x360=4320) and (100x?-12x360) then divide 4320 (your anser) by 100 (4320 divided by 100=43) often the first few digits of your answer is the degrees.
so the question should be like 12x100 *divided* 100=12) (12x360=4320 and 100X?=12x360) ?=43
sorry if it doesnt work but it should! :( ;D
